meanings.definition: To force or compel someone to do something
meanings.sent1: The teacher ramrodded the students to complete their homework on time.
meanings.sent2: The coach ramrodded the team to give their best performance in the game.
meanings.sent3: The parent ramrodded the child to finish their vegetables before having dessert.
meanings.sent4: The strict rules ramrodded the employees into following the safety protocols.
meanings.sent5: The urgent deadline ramrodded everyone to work together efficiently.

meanings.definition: To push or drive something forcefully
meanings.sent1: He ramrodded the heavy cart up the hill with determination.
meanings.sent2: The worker ramrodded the wheelbarrow filled with bricks across the construction site.
meanings.sent3: The wind ramrodded the leaves along the sidewalk in a playful dance.
meanings.sent4: The strong current ramrodded the boat downstream faster than expected.
meanings.sent5: The bulldozer ramrodded through the debris to clear the path.

meanings.definition: To manage or control a situation aggressively
meanings.sent1: The supervisor ramrodded the chaotic meeting to ensure decisions were made.
meanings.sent2: The principal ramrodded the school assembly to maintain order among the students.
meanings.sent3: The chef ramrodded the busy kitchen during dinner rush with precision.
meanings.sent4: The captain ramrodded the team strategy to secure a victory in the match.
meanings.sent5: The director ramrodded the film production to meet the tight deadline.
